dt: {bc}the rarefied element formerly believed to fill the upper regions of space
{bc}a light volatile flammable liquid C{inf}4{/inf}H{inf}10{/inf}O used chiefly as a solvent and especially formerly as an anesthetic
{bc}any of a class of organic compounds characterized by an oxygen atom attached to two carbon atoms
{bc}a medium that in the wave theory of light permeates all space and transmits transverse waves

et: Middle English, from Latin {it}aether{/it}, from Greek {it}aithēr{/it}, from {it}aithein{/it} to ignite, blaze; akin to Old English {it}ād{/it} pyre {ma}{mat|edify|}{/ma}
shortdef: the rarefied element formerly believed to fill the upper regions of space
the upper regions of space : heavens
a light volatile flammable liquid C4H10O used chiefly as a solvent and especially formerly as an anesthetic
